p: In an HIV-1 outbreak in Romanian orphanages, children received around 147 injections per year (according to a detailed study based on one of the orphanages) [ 123]. Estimates for injection intensity in nosocomial outbreaks in Elista, Russia, and in Lybia give an annualized rate of 40â€“200 and 52, respectively; in both of the latter outbreaks, HIV-1 transmission was probably boosted by the use of venous catheters and lines in many patients; no reliable estimates exist for the other outbreaks [ 124].
